summary: Tested Internal Meeting Management System features. All 26 backend API tests passed (100%). Frontend UI verified - all features working correctly including meeting CRUD, discussion notes, follow-up points, schedule follow-up meeting, notification bell, and analytics.

minor.issue: Route order issue fixed - was being caught by /{notification_id} route

issues: Top Organizers/Attendees shows 'Unknown' instead of employee name - employee lookup not finding admin user's name

passed_tests: Backend: POST /api/meetings/create - Create meeting with all fields
Backend: GET /api/meetings/{id} - Get meeting details with activities
Backend: GET /api/meetings/{id} - Returns 404 for non-existent meeting
Backend: PUT /api/meetings/{id}/notes/{note_id} - Edit note with edit tracking
Backend: GET /api/meetings/{id}/series - Get meeting series chain
Frontend: Meetings page loads with analytics cards
Frontend: Create Meeting dialog opens with all fields
Frontend: Meeting detail dialog shows all sections (participants, agenda, notes, follow-ups, activity log)
Frontend: Notification bell shows dropdown with notifications
Frontend: Analytics tab shows frequency chart and top organizers/attendees
action_items: Minor: Fix employee name lookup in analytics - Top Organizers/Attendees shows 'Unknown' for admin user
critical_code_review_comments: Route order in notifications.py was incorrect - /clear-all was after /{notification_id} causing it to be caught by the dynamic route. Fixed by reordering.
Meeting CRUD operations properly implement access control (organizer/participant/HR)
Discussion notes have edit tracking with edit_history array
Follow-up points correctly transfer to agenda items when scheduling follow-up meeting
Analytics endpoint properly calculates follow-up completion rate and meeting frequency
seed_data_creation: Test meetings created and cleaned up after tests
context_for_next_testing_agent: Meeting Management System fully tested: 1) Meetings CRUD - Create/Read/Update/Delete meetings with subject, date, time, location, participants, agenda items. 2) Discussion Notes - Add/Edit/Delete notes with edit tracking. 3) Follow-up Points - Add follow-ups with assignee, toggle completion status. 4) Schedule Follow-up - Creates linked meeting with follow-up points as agenda. 5) Notifications - Bell icon in header with dropdown, list/mark-read/clear endpoints. 6) Analytics - Overview with total meetings, follow-up rate, frequency by day, top organizers/attendees. Test file: /app/backend/tests/test_meetings_notifications.py
